greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Iterative mapping with offset: a(1)=46465694290, a(n)=A095904(a(n-1)-2).
comment: The last term listed, a(28), is 547^16. Of the sequences of type a(n)=A095904(a(n-1)-2), this contains the smallest integer (6) that is part of an unknown sequence type (i.e. it is unknown if this sequence continues indefinitely in both directions or is part of a loop.)
link: Will Nicholes, Iterative mapping of prime signatures.
results.author: _Will Nicholes_, Jul 10 2010
